item.title: Crossing the Ethiopian Border by Land
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
Ethiopia has land borders with 7 countries: Somalia, Somaliland, Djibouti, Kenya, Eritrea, Sudan, and South Sudan. Visas will not be issued at any of these borders and so it is essential that you obtain a visa to Ethiopia before embarking on your border crossing. Since 2017, Ethiopia is offering nationals of all countries the Ethiopia […]

The post Crossing the Ethiopian Border by Land appeared first on Ethiopia Online Visa.

item.title: Addis Ababa, the capital and the largest city of Ethiopia
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
There is an incredible amount of things do do in Addis Ababa. Ethiopia’s exciting capital city is not just one of the most vibrant and eclectic cities in the country, it is often referred to as the capital of Africa. Its name translates to “new flower” in the Amharic language which reflects its youthful, lively […]

item.title: Documents Needed to Travel to Ethiopia
item.dc:creator: cristina
item.description:
Many people travel to Ethiopia to explore the vast landscape, ancient culture, and natural wonders and wildlife. In order to travel to Ethiopia, it’s important to check what documents you need to travel to Ethiopia. Depending on your nationality, it might be necessary to apply for a visa. item.title: How to renew your Ethiopian eVisa
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
Renewing an Ethiopian eVisa is just as quick and straightforward as the original visa application process. Applicants just need to complete the online application form and pay a fee using a credit or debit card. Once submitted, Ethiopia eVisa renewal applications are normally processed within 24 hours. The form is very simple, applicants need to […]

item.title: Ethiopia World Heritage Attractions
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
Ethiopia’s cities contain a wealth of exciting attractions and festivities for tourists to explore, such as the unique Meskel True Cross celebration in Addis Ababa. However, to really delve into the culture and history, visitors should head to the countryside to explore some of the many stunning World Heritage attractions in Ethiopia. Many of these […]

item.title: When is the best time to visit Ethiopia?
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
Ethiopia is one of the most incredible places to visit in Africa. Known as the ‘Cradle of Mankind’, it has a long and fascinating history, a rich and diverse culture, breathtaking landscapes, and a jaw-dropping range of wildlife. Though you may imagine Ethiopia being a hot, dry country which is uncomfortable to visit, this is […]

item.description:
Ethiopia is one of the world’s oldest societies and intrigues many travelers every year to visit with its remarkable landscapes and an extraordinary history. item.title: The Ethiopian Calendar
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
Anyone who has ever been to Ethiopia knows that time works differently there. Just like Ethiopia has its own language, Amharic, so too does it have its own calendar. For example, while most of the rest of the world celebrates the end of the year on December 31st, Ethiopian New Year falls on September 11th […]

item.title: Ethiopia Visa on Arrival: A Complete Guide
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
Ethiopia’s popularity as a holiday destination continues to grow. It is a truly breathtaking country and ideal for safari and wildlife-lovers. Thankfully getting there has never been easier. item.title: Amharic: the Ethiopian Language
item.dc:creator: Visas
item.description:
“The limits of my language means the limits of my world.” – Ludwig Wittgenstein Languages are not simply a tool for communication but offer an insight into a different world, culture and way of living.
